summary: This is an email chain from March 7, 2019, discussing a fresh court battle that could expose more details in Alex Acosta's controversial plea deal with Jeffrey Epstein. It references a Second Circuit hearing and a media request to unseal documents.

persons.name: Alex Acosta
persons.context: Mentioned in the subject line regarding his controversial plea deal with Jeffrey Epstein. The email discusses litigation that could expose more details about this deal.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the controversial plea deal with Alex Acosta. The court battle discussed may expose more details about this agreement.

persons.name: Judge Sweet
persons.context: The email states 'It's the Judge Sweet case,' indicating a legal proceeding before this judge that deals with media access to summary judgment briefs under a protective order.

connections.description: Acosta, as a former U.S. Attorney, was involved in negotiating a controversial plea deal for Epstein.

events.title: Second Circuit Hearing on Media Access
events.description: The Second Circuit Court of Appeals heard arguments regarding media access to summary judgment briefs in the 'Judge Sweet case,' which is related to the Epstein plea deal, given an existing protective order.

events.title: Politico Article on Epstein Plea Deal
events.description: Politico published an article titled 'Fresh court battle could expose more details in Acosta's controversial Epstein plea deal,' which is referenced in the email chain.

keyFacts: A court battle was ongoing in March 2019 that could expose more details about the controversial plea deal between Alex Acosta and Jeffrey Epstein.
The Second Circuit Court of Appeals heard arguments on March 6, 2019, regarding media access to sealed court documents (summary judgment briefs) in a case before Judge Sweet.
The email chain shows internal interest in the 'unsealing component' of this litigation, indicating it was relevant to other ongoing legal applications.
